Package standardAttributes

Class FlashText

  • java.lang.Object
    • gerberFileReader.Attribute
      • standardAttributes.StandardAttribute
        • standardAttributes.FlashText
  • public class FlashText
extends StandardAttribute
    A class to represent the Gerber Standard Attribute ".FlashText"

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  FlashText.TextRepresentation
      An enumeration of the possible ways text may be represented: FlashText.TextRepresentation.Barcode, FlashText.TextRepresentation.Characters, or FlashText.TextRepresentation.Unknown

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String GERBER_STANDARD_ATTRIBUTE_NAME
      The string used in Gerber files as the name for Flash Text Standard Attributes: ".FlashText"

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FlashText()
      Constructs an empty Flash Text Standard Attribute, call StandardAttribute.initialize(Attribute) to initialize the contents of this Flash Text Standard Attribute.
      FlashText​(java.lang.String cmd)
      Constructs a Flash Text Standard Attribute from a Gerber TA extended command.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String getComment()
      Gets any extra information about the text.
      java.lang.String getFontName()
      Gets the font name.
      java.lang.String getFontSize()
      Gets the font size as a string.
      java.lang.String getGerberStandardAttributeName()
      Gets the standard attribute's name as specified in the Gerber Layer Format Specification, should always return a string beginning with a "." character.
      java.lang.String getText()
      Gets the text represented by the object to which this attribute is attached.
      FlashText.TextRepresentation getTextRepresentation()
      Gets how the text is represented.
      boolean isBarcode()
      Checks if the text is represented by a machine readable barcode.
      boolean isCharacters()
      Checks if the text is represented by human readable characters.
      boolean isTextMirrored()
      Checks if the text is specified to be mirrored left-to-right.
      boolean isTextReadable()
      Checks if the text is specified to be readable, that is, non-mirrored.
      void validate()
      Validates the Standard Attribute to ensure all values are of proper type and range.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlashText

        public FlashText()
        Constructs an empty Flash Text Standard Attribute, call StandardAttribute.initialize(Attribute) to initialize the contents of this Flash Text Standard Attribute.

      • FlashText

        public FlashText​(java.lang.String cmd)
          throws GerberLayerFormatException
        Constructs a Flash Text Standard Attribute from a Gerber TA extended command.
        Parameters:
        cmd - the Gerber command
        Throws:
        GerberLayerFormatException - if the command does not properly define a Flash Text Standard Attribute

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Gets the text represented by the object to which this attribute is attached.

      • isBarcode

        public boolean isBarcode()
        Checks if the text is represented by a machine readable barcode.
        Returns:
        true if the text is represented by a machine readable barcode
        See Also:
        getTextRepresentation(), isCharacters()

      • isCharacters

        public boolean isCharacters()
        Checks if the text is represented by human readable characters.
        Returns:
        true if the text is represented by human readable characters
        See Also:
        getTextRepresentation(), isBarcode()

      • isTextReadable

        public boolean isTextReadable()
        Checks if the text is specified to be readable, that is, non-mirrored. Since the readable/mirrored field is optional, this method returns false if the field is not specified.
        Returns:
        true if the text is non-mirrored
        See Also:
        isTextMirrored()

      • isTextMirrored

        public boolean isTextMirrored()
        Checks if the text is specified to be mirrored left-to-right. Since the readable/mirrored field is optional, this method returns false if the field is not specified.
        Returns:
        true if the text is mirrored left-to-right
        See Also:
        isTextReadable()

      • getFontName

        public java.lang.String getFontName()
        Gets the font name.
        Returns:
        the font name or an empty string if the font name is not specified
        See Also:
        getFontSize()

      • getFontSize

        public java.lang.String getFontSize()
        Gets the font size as a string.
        Returns:
        the font size or an empty string if the font size is not specified
        See Also:
        getFontName()

      • getComment

        public java.lang.String getComment()
        Gets any extra information about the text.
        Returns:
        the extra information or an empty string in no extra information is specified

      • getGerberStandardAttributeName

        public java.lang.String getGerberStandardAttributeName()
        Description copied from class: StandardAttribute
        Gets the standard attribute's name as specified in the Gerber Layer Format Specification, should always return a string beginning with a "." character.

      • validate

        public void validate()
              throws GerberLayerFormatException
        Description copied from class: StandardAttribute
        Validates the Standard Attribute to ensure all values are of proper type and range.
        Specified by:
        validate in class StandardAttribute
        Throws:
        GerberLayerFormatException - if the contents of the specified attribute are not valid per the Gerber Layer Format Specification.
